alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 12:26PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Windsor County through 130 PM EDT... At 1225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Andover, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Windsor, Cavendish, Andover, Perkinsville Village, Ascutney, Baltimore, Springfield, Weathersfield, West Windsor, Weston, Ludlow, Reading, Perkinsville, Felchville, Brownsville, North Chester, Ascutney State Park, North Springfield Lake Recreation Area and Proctorsville. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 40 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
